text: Elegia fallax is a moth of the family Pyralidae. It is known from Spain, Portugal, France, Italy, Croatia, the Czech Republic, Slovenia, Hungary, Romania, Bulgaria, North Macedonia and Greece. It has also been recorded from the Channel Islands in 2005. The wingspan is 17–19 mm. The larvae feed on Quercus (oak) species. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1881 Category:Phycitini Category:Moths of Europe Category:Moths of Turkey
title: Elegia fallax
